title: Religious diversity in Middle East/North Africa in 2010 , by religion
summary: This is a bar chart representing Religion in the x axis and Percentage of population in the y axis.
The maximum Percentage of population 93.0 is found at Religion Muslims and the minimum is found at Unaffiliated where Religion is 1.0.
There is a difference of 92.0 between the maximum Religion Muslims and minimum Religion Unaffiliated.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Percentage of population for 5 number of Religions.
Religion Muslims has the highest Percentage of population and Unaffiliated has the lowest Percentage of population.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Religion in the x axis and Percentage of population in the y axis.
The maximum Percentage of population 93.0 is found at Religion Muslims and the minimum is found at Unaffiliated where Religion is 1.0.
There is a difference of 92.0 between the maximum Religion Muslims and minimum Religion Unaffiliated.
max_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Religion, and Percentage of population in each Religion on the y axis.
Religion Muslims has the highest Percentage of population and Unaffiliated has the lowest Percentage of population.
There is a difference of 92.0 between the maximum Religion Muslims and minimum Religion Unaffiliated.
Religion Muslims is higher than any other Religions with value 93.0, followed by Christians, and Jews. Down to Religion Unaffiliated with the lowest value 1.0.
Religion Unaffiliated, and Hindus have the same Percentage of population.
The highest value 93.0 at Muslims is almost 4.6 times larger than the average value 20.2.
The Percentage of population is 101.0 if we add up values of all Religions.
